ys.probabilistic.util

Interface LinearCounter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of values being counted
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AggregateLinearCounter, WriteConcurrentLinearCounter

    public interface LinearCounter<T>
    A probabilistic data structure to estimate the cardinality of the data set in a linear time and using a small amount of memory. It's implemented by using the bitmap and the hash function.
    Author:
    Yauheni Shahun

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BLOCK_SIZE
      Size in bits of the int block that the bitmap consists of.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the counter's state (bitmap).
      void count(T value)
      Counts the given value.
      int[] getBitmap()
      Returns a copy of the underlying bitmap (if other isn't mentioned) represented as int array.
      double getCardinality()
      Gets the cardinality of the observed values.
      void mergeTo(int[] otherBitmap)
      Merges the internal bitmap into the given bitmap represented as int array.

    • Field Detail

      • BLOCK_SIZE

        static final int BLOCK_SIZE
        Size in bits of the int block that the bitmap consists of.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • count

        void count(T value)
        Counts the given value.

      • getCardinality

        double getCardinality()
        Gets the cardinality of the observed values.
        Returns:
        estimated cardinality as double

      • getBitmap

        int[] getBitmap()
        Returns a copy of the underlying bitmap (if other isn't mentioned) represented as int array. This can be used for calculating aggregate cardinalities.

      • mergeTo

        void mergeTo(int[] otherBitmap)
        Merges the internal bitmap into the given bitmap represented as int array. This can be used for calculating aggregate cardinalities.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the counter's state (bitmap).
